meanings.definition: The amount by which a container falls short of being full.
meanings.sent1: The ullages in the jar indicated it was not completely full.
meanings.sent2: The cook measured the ullages in the pot before adding more ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The party host joked that the ullages in the punch bowl were due to thirsty guests.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the room, filling the ullages of silence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used marbles to demonstrate the concept of ullages to the students.

meanings.definition: The empty space in a container above the liquid or solid contents.
meanings.sent1: When pouring the drink, he noticed the ullages at the top of the glass.
meanings.sent2: The bottle had ullages that allowed for expansion of the liquid during transportation.
meanings.sent3: The cat curiously peeked into the box, investigating the ullages above the toys.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled in the ullages of her mind, waiting to be organized.
meanings.sent5: The balloon slowly deflated, leaving ullages of air at the top.
